<<<code>>>: Object o = lv1.getItemAtPosition(position);
ItemDetail obj_ItemDetail = (ItemDetail)o;
new AlertDialog.Builder(view.getContext())
.setIcon(obj_ItemDetail.getImageNumber())
.setMessage(obj_ItemDetail.getItemDescription())
.setNegativeButton("Close", null).show();
Toast.makeText(ListViewImageActivity.this, "Anda Memilih : " + " " + obj_ItemDetail.getName(), Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, the arraylist "image_detail" is populated with ItemDetail objects. To show the selected item in an AlertDialog, the getItemAtPosition() method is used to retrieve the selected item from the ListView. The retrieved item is then cast to the ItemDetail class. The AlertDialog.Builder class is used to create an AlertDialog with the image number and item description of the selected item. Finally, a Toast message is displayed with the name of the selected item.

   item_detail.setName("Purple");    item_detail.setItemDescription("Cupcake");    item_detail.setPrice("6.000");    item_detail.setImageNumber(3);    result.add(item_detail);    return result;}}this is my code :public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
